Hello, it's the friday talkie.

12.text:
from usual, not a lot, just a tiny little

17.text:
and stuff, as I go along.
First, difference, I'm gonna tell you what

24.text:
I'm going to talk about, and I might even
include links on here or I might not.

35.text:
My camera's putting little funny icons on
just there, and I don't know what they were

40.text:
for.
Um, anyway... yeah, so what am I going to

44.text:
be talking about?
First of all I'm going to do a response to

48.text:
a video by thejoyofsticks, er, why do you

I shall talk about that... and then I shall

61.text:
what is your gaming timeline?
and by that he means what systems did you

66.text:
have like in what order, and when and stuff

Umm... and I'm going to close, probably not

75.text:
um.. optimising your youtube channel.
Ways of getting seen more, more subscribers,

83.text:
more views, stuff like that.
Potential methods for.... getting more out

90.text:
of youtube, if you're a youtube video producer

96.text:
Okay, so... that's the first difference this
week, telling you what I'm doing before I

102.text:
do it.
There is a reason for this. I'll go into that

105.text:
later.
So... thejoyofsticks... stickhead... why do

113.text:
you play retro games?
Inititally, I thought this will be a really

119.text:
quick and easy answer, and I can answer this
in one sentence... and I realised actually

125.text:
that's not true.
And the answer isn't as simple as I'd initially

131.text:
thought it was.
Because the obvious answer is nostalgia. I

138.text:
played these games when I was a teen or in
my early twentys and stuff like that, and

146.text:
I like to relive that experience,
and the emotions that go with it.

151.text:
That would be the obvious answer.
But it's not strictly true.

156.text:
It's absolutely not as simple as that with
me.

161.text:
Umm.
The.... Because I'm a hardware collector,

169.text:
now I buy the hardware, the retro hardware,
because... uhhh....

177.text:
because I know about them.
Hahaha...

179.text:
It all comes back to when I was a kid, in
school, and here was this lad with all these

184.text:
computer magazines saying ooh look at this
machine here and this one he... and... I remember

188.text:
them all, and I remember thinking when I was
like sixteen or seventeen or maybe fiftteen,

193.text:
something like that, when I grow up (still
hasn't happened yet, I'm sure) gonna have

200.text:
one of them, or all of them, or something.
I'm gonna have the best computer and I want

204.text:
one of these and
All of these computers that I wanted, I'd

208.text:
heard of them, I'd seen pictures of them,
I was impressed by them, I wanted them, I

214.text:
couldn't afford them.
So donkeys years down the line, I find them

218.text:
turning up at carboot sales, dirt cheap and
later on ebay, initially dirt cheap. Um..

225.text:
now they're getting really quite expensive.
Umm... So, it's not really a nostalgia thing.

232.text:
It's fulfilling a childhood wish, if you like.
Umm.. I can so I do, though at the moment

239.text:
I can't so I don't, but I've got most of what
I wanted anyway, so it's alright.

243.text:
But the actual playing of the games... there
is... it's absolutely true, there is some

249.text:
nostalgia in playing quite a lot of them.
The ones that I played as a teen and a twentysomething

256.text:
person.
Umm... Atari 2600... there is a lot of nostalgia

261.text:
in playing that.
Some ZX81, there's... there is immense nostalgia...

267.text:
but that's actually not... why I play retro
games.

274.text:
And there's the thing, I... I am a retro collector
of hardware, but I'm not a retro collector

279.text:
of gaming...
It... it... I.. I.. quite frequently sort

282.text:
of explain that there is a difference. I'm
not a gaming collector.

286.text:
I happen to have a large collection of games.
But... they just accumulate as I buy the hardware.

294.text:
I accumulate software.
But I am buying the software not to collect

299.text:
it, but to play it.
But I'm not doing it because... I... I am

307.text:
a retro gamer, but I'm not playing them because
they're retro, and there's the thing.

314.text:
It's probably inaccurate to describe me as
a retro gamer.

319.text:
Yeah, who'd have thunk that?
If I sit and really think about it.

324.text:
I'm not a retro gamer, I'm just a gamer.
The thing is, if I sit and analyse how I think

333.text:
about all of these games I've got... I look
up there, I've got PS3, PS2, PS1, XBox 1,

340.text:
DS, Mega Drive, 32X... y'know... tons of it...
and I don't separate them. In my head... in

348.text:
my mind tank, or my brain box...
I have not got separate drawers. This is modern...

354.text:
this is retro, and shuffle them about as they
get older.

358.text:
The hardware, I do.
The games... are games and I'm a gamer.

364.text:
And I don't sit there playing...
I'm playing 32X... no... I'm playing C.. duhh...

371.text:
god... engage brain...
I'm playing Mega CD games at the moment, and

376.text:
when I'm playing them, I'm not thinking...
oh.. this is some classic retro gaming...

381.text:
That's not what's going through my head.
That's not what the experience is to me.

387.text:
It's this is a great video game.
Or.. this is not a very good video game.

392.text:
It's just a video game.
Doesn't matter what it's on.

395.text:
Doesn't matter how old it is.
Umm...

399.text:
There isn't... In my head there is no difference.
Some are older.

405.text:
But it doesn't matter, it's either a good
game, or it isn't a good game.

410.text:
Umm...
Some games don't age very well, and you look

416.text:
at them and they're dated and they're not
as good as you remember them.

421.text:
But that probably comes from naivety at the
time that you played them,

427.text:
because in all honesty, if they're not a good
game now, they weren't a good game then.

431.text:
There will have been something that was new
about them that impressed you at the time.

437.text:
Maybe a new graphical technique.
Maybe it was a new genre.

441.text:

I do.

447.text:
Umm...
A good game is always a good game.

449.text:
It will never stop being a good game.
A mediocre game that had an impressive something

456.text:
about it...
may have been impressive at the time but won't

460.text:
be now, but if it doesn't impress now, it
wasn't a good game.

466.text:
There may be people who disagree, but... yeah.
To me, I... retro... doesn't even come into

476.text:
I'm a gamer.
And when that game was made is absolutely

481.text:
irrelevant.
The game that keeps coming to mind every single

time is Defender.
Defender to me is one of the perfect games

out there.
It is one of the best games ever made... ever..

498.text:
on any system.
It's not my favourite, but...

506.text:

And the fact that it will be retro... it'll
be uber retro... it'll be a bleedin' antique...

516.text:
doesn't matter.
It'll be, I dunno, when do things become ancient?

521.text:
I dunno.
But when it becomes ancient, It'll still be

523.text:
a great video game.
The fact that it's retro is irrelevant.

527.text:
And that's kind of how I view video games.
Why do you play retro games?

533.text:
Because I like games, and a lot of games are
retro.

537.text:
I think that c... yeah.....
It's not... It's kind of straightforward,

but when I actually come to think about it,

550.text:
Coz I though it's just a nostalgia thing,
but it aint.

Um.. there is nostalgia for sure, but it's

558.text:
good games are good.

And it doesn't matter how old they are.
